--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Jim Gilbert" <jggilbert@E...> 
wrote:
> Milt,
> The plate and the nunome zogan look more like Shoami work.  The Awa 
Shoami did a lot of that kind of busy nunome, but the sukashi is a bit 
unusual for them.  More profusely decorated guards with that kind of 
nunome are often called Kyo Kenjo.  The fukurin might be original.
> 
> Kumagai is the correct spelling.  Higo style nunome is a bit 
different.
> 
> Jim
> 
> 
>
thanks, Jim.

milt
